fields.Name: Final project submissions
fields.Description: If you'd like to be in the running for the prizes, submit your project by midnight UTC time.

fields.Name: Accessibility Office Hours 2
fields.Description: Swing by with your questions about accessibility.

fields.Name: Austin Bitcoin Design Club live crit
fields.Description: There will be a live design review of 2-3 Designathon projects. Shout-out to the [Austin Bitcoin Design Club](http://abdc.dev).

fields.Name: Prize announcements
fields.Description: After all projects are submitted, the judges will get busy and review all the projects. Then we'll jump onto a call and announce who will receive the prizes. Join us there as we wrap up the Designathon and celebrate everyone's contributions.

fields.Name: UX Research workshop
fields.Description: This workshop will be focussed on providing tools and knowledge to teams based on how to do quick research that is specific to the project which they are working on. Projects will have a few mins to quickly share some details about what they are working on and research suggestions based on the Bitcoin UX Research toolkit will be provided. These are for those who would like to adopt a user first or data driven approach to building their product.

fields.Name: Design-a-Note – Make Bitcoin Printable
fields.Description: In this workshop, we’ll explore the world of printable bitcoin ecash notes and show you how to use [brrr.gandlaf.com](https://brrr.gandlaf.com), a tool that turns sats into handout-worthy paper notes. We’ll walk through how the tool works, share a bit of the history behind printable bitcoin projects, and showcase inspiring examples from past bitcoin note design. This session also serves as a primer for the Design-a-Note challenge—so if you’re thinking about submitting a design, or just want to learn what it’s all about, this is a great place to start.

fields.Name: Accessibility Office Hours 1
fields.Description: Swing by with your questions about accessibility.

fields.Name: Kick-off call 2
fields.Description: Join us if you can to start the designathon in a video call. If you can't make it, all updates will also be posted in the #designathon channel on Discord.

fields.Name: Global Accessibility Awareness Day Workshop 2
fields.Description: Accessibility Testing, Tools, and Design Pattern Resources. In honor of [Global Accessibility Awareness Day](http://accessibility.day).

fields.Name: Global Accessibility Awareness Day Workshop 1
fields.Description: Intro to Disability Use Cases, Assistive Technologies, and Universal Design. In honor of [Global Accessibility Awareness Day](http://accessibility.day).

fields.Name: Designathon Call #16: Presentations Round 2
fields.Description: If you participated in the Designathon, this is the time to present your project. For everyone else, join to learn and celebrate what everyone worked on.

fields.Name: Kick-off call 1
fields.Description: Join us if you can to start the designathon in a video call. If you can't make it, all updates will also be posted in the #designathon channel on Discord.

fields.Name: Jam Session #2
fields.Description: Join this session if you'd like to discuss your Designathon project or want to help others with their projects.

fields.Name: Designathon Call #15: Presentations Round 1
fields.Description: If you participated in the Designathon, this is the time to present your project. For everyone else, join to learn and celebrate what everyone worked on.

fields.Name: Jam Session #3
fields.Description: Join this session if you'd like to discuss your Designathon project or want to help others with their projects.

fields.Name: Penpot workshop
fields.Description: A hands-on introduction to the open-source design tool [Penpot](https://penpot.app). We’ll cover all the basics of setting up your account, joining a team and getting started with the design tools.

fields.Name: Accessibility Resources for Designers and Developers
fields.Description: This workshop will focus on common accessibility issues in bitcoin-related software, as well as the tools and resources needed to start designing, developing, and improving the accessibility of bitcoin products.

fields.Name: Jam Session #1
fields.Description: Join this session if you'd like to discuss your Designathon project or want to help others with their projects.

fields.Name: UX Research workshop
fields.Description: This workshop will be focussed on providing tools and knowledge to teams based on how to do quick research that is specific to the project which they are working on. Projects will have a few mins to quickly share some details about what they are working on and research suggestions based on the Bitcoin UX Research toolkit will be provided. These are for those who would like to adopt a user first or data driven approach to building their product.
